content:
Tony Voss6:40 PM
https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/plugins is not being updated. Need to go here:
https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/main/opencpn-plugins/index.html
Everything now starts here:
https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/main
The manual links in opencpn.org are correct.

Tony Voss6:40 PM
https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/plugins is not being updated. Need to go here:
https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/main/opencpn-plugins/index.html

Indeed, that's how it is these days. We should perhaps put some info in https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/plugins describing the new situation...

So the correct location for the manual page, in the case of the JavaScript plugin is:
https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/main/javascript/index.html

(1) If I arrive via the OpenCPN front page and follow Plugins, I get to:
https://www.opencpn.org/OpenCPN/plugins/javascript.html

(2) If I go via the downloads directory at https://www.opencpn.org/OpenCPN/info/downloadplugins.html
I get sent to same as (1) above.

(3) https://opencpn-manuals.github.io/plugins/javascript/0.1/index.html still exists but shows an old version

Who should I report this to so that we can have a consistent result?
For (1) and (2) the manual link takes you to the correct page. We just need to remove (3). This is left from a previous workflow. I will raise an issue for the opencpn-manuals/plugins repo.
I have unpublished the website (3). You should get a 404 if you delete your cache.

(1) & (2) take me to a description that includes the old method of installing by downloading a package. Its parent page does not show the JS plugin as available via the plugin manager.
Who should I contact about getting this updated, please?
Have sent you an email with the email address for Kathi Boswell, who manages the opencpn.org website. She will be happy to change the pages.
